revised_title: On the Capacity for Heat of Water and the Mechanical Equivalent of Heat
tldr: This article presents experiments conducted in the Macdonald Physical Laboratory of McGill University to determine the heat capacity of water between freezing and boiling points and the mechanical equivalent of heat in terms of international electrical units. The authors used the continuous-flow method of calorimetry and found that the specific heat of water varies with temperature. They also calculated the mechanical equivalent of heat, which is essential for understanding the relationship between heat and energy.
